intro: Hieracium poliothapsinum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its bright yellow flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
